result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:38 AM Defendant Kari L Pavia in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Walker Esq in court for Kari L Pavia.  Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Sara Rogan. 
Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Plea - 21CF1896 Cts 1 & 3 GUILTY. 
22CF706 Ct 1 GUILTY. 
Factual basis found in complaint. 
BTC: 21CF1896 Cts 1 & 3 GUILTY with Ct 2 being dismissed and read in. 22CF706 Ct 1 GUILTY with Ct 2 being dismissed and read in. 22CF966 will be dismissed and read in.  
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 
21CF1896
Ct 1-
4 years Wisconsin Prison System 2 years initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed. 
3 years probation.

Conditions of probation:
120 days Racine County Jail with 60 stayed and 60 to serve upfront report in 11/1 at 8:30am. 
No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician, to be  monitored accordingly. 
Medication assisted treatment allowed. 
Any assessments/counseling/treatment deemed appropriate by agent.
Obtain/maintain full-time employment and or schooling.
No contact with M.C.
No contact with WALMART. 
No contact with any known drug dealers or users. 
Obtain GED or HSED. 
Do not drive unless properly licensed. 
Firearm warning.
Voting warning.
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA Surcharge

Defendant is not eligible for CIP.
Defendant is eligible for SAP. 

Ct 3-
30 days Racine County Jail imposed and stayed concurrent to Ct 1. . 
3 years probation. 

22CF706-
Ct 1-
4 years Wisconsin Prison System 2 years initial confinement with 2 years extended supervision imposed and stayed concurrent to 21CF1896. 
3 years probation.

notice of hearing
Fingerprints/mugshots completed on 07/21/2022 at 2:38 pm
Emailed Dispatch at 2:19pm

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with Michael Cantwell. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:15 PM Prosecuting attorney Kelsey L. Blumenfeld in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kari L Pavia in court.  Attorney Laura Ann Walker Esq in court for Kari L Pavia. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
BTC: Vacate Warrant, Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
